entities.description: A variable where values are logically assigned, edited, or imputed based on interview responses.
Variables relating to the use of various substances, including tobacco, alcohol, and illicit drugs.
Indicators associated with imputation-revised variables, showing whether the variable has a legitimate skip or imputed value.
The individual providing responses in the survey.
Variables capturing how recently a respondent used a substance.
The variable capturing whether the respondent ever used a substance in their lifetime.
The responses given by the respondents in the NSDUH survey.
Different types of drugs and substances addressed in the survey, such as alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, etc.

relationships.description: Indicates that a response has an imputation-revised variable.
Associates imputation-revised variables with their respective imputation indicators.
Indicates that the imputation-revised variable is related to drug use.
Connects the survey responses to the individual respondent.
Indicates that the drug use variable relates to how recently a substance was used.
Indicates that the drug use variable includes information on lifetime use.
Details that the drug use variable includes specific substances such as alcohol, marijuana, etc.
